title: How To Grow Healing Herbs [static PDF]
description:
How To Grow Healing Herbs

Author: Astrid Derfler (w/ Jim O'Brien)
Year: UNK (poss. 1993-1994)
Publisher: Globe Communications
Series: Globe Mini Mag
UPC-A: 089955068792
Pub ID: 1546/275

 Originally an inexpensive, smallish booklet of the Globe Mini Mag series intended as an overview of growing one's own herbs in-house or outdoors, garden planning & planting, as well as history & usage for 23 herbs*, and finally their harvesting, preparation & storage.

 By growing your own herbs, one can control all aspects of their growth, ensure freshness from harvest to use, save money on fresh herbs for specific culinary needs, have a ready-source for personally thoughtful gifting, and fully benefit from the garden's aesthetic qualities (appearance, formality, and scent).

*herbs discussed: alfafa, aloe, anise, boneset, cayenne, chamomile, cranberry, dandelion, echinacea, elder, garlic, ginger, ginseng, goldenseal, marigold, marsh mallow, meadowsweet, peppermint/spearmint, red clover, rhubarb, slippery elm, thyme, valerian.

Content headings include...
 Why Grow Herbs?
 Planting the Garden
 An Indoor Garden
 The Herbs
 Drying & Storing

---
64 pages + covers
Scan (LXK X4650, color, 300dpi), static conversion (non-OCR), and bookmarking done by Greencuppa.
